resources.string: nPhoneKIT Settings (you must restart nPhoneKIT to fully apply)
Error: Your device is not connected!

Error: Please check your connnection to your device: 
1. Make sure the device is plugged in.
2. Make sure the device is in MTP mode (allow access to phone data)
3. Try enabling DEVELOPER SETTINGS on your device and try again.
No Samsung USB found. Skipping preload.
[Warning] Could not check for updates, check your internet connection?

Steps to continue (PLEASE READ CAREFULLY, THEN CLOSE THE MESSAGE BOX.):

1. Plug one end of a USB cable into your computer, and the other end into the device.

2. When the cable is plugged in, press ALLOW ACCESS TO PHONE DATA, and you may now close the message box to continue.

Steps to continue (PLEASE READ CAREFULLY, THEN CLOSE THE MESSAGE BOX.):

1. Enable developer options by going into settings,
about phone, software information, and tap build number 
 7 times. 

2. Go back into settings, scroll to
 the bottom, open developer options, scroll down a bit, 
 find USB Debugging, and turn it on. 

 3. Plug one end of a USB cable into your computer, and the other end into the device.

4. When the cable is plugged in, you may now close the message box to continue. If you ever see a dialog after this, please always click ALLOW.
\nERROR, please make sure your device is plugged in, and in the *#0*# menu.

Warning: This FRP unlock method may not always work. It will perform best on devices pre-2022. 


This feature is intended only for owners of devices they personally own or are legally authorized to access. 
Unauthorized use may violate local laws. The developer assumes no responsibility for misuse.

Steps to FRP Unlock (method A) (PLEASE READ CAREFULLY, THEN CLOSE THE MESSAGE BOX.):

1. Factory reset the device using the recovery menu. 
If this has already been done, proceed to step 2.

2. Boot up the phone normally. You should see the setup screen. 
Locate a button called something like 'Emergency Call', and click it.
 This usually opens the dialer. If it calls immediately, 
this method will NOT work on your device.

3. After pressing the Emergency Call button, the dialer should be visible. 
Please continue by typing in the following (without quotes): '*#0*#', and press CALL.
 A service/test menu should be opened. If not, you can also try '*#*#88#*#*'. 
If neither of these work, this method will NOT work on your device.

4. Once the service/test menu is open, do not touch anything on the screen. 
Plug one end of a USB cable into your computer, and the other end into the device.

5. When the cable is plugged in, you may now close the message box to continue.
\nThis FRP unlock method will not work on your device.
\nUNLOCK should be successful! To complete the unlock, please go into settings and perform a factory reset normally!

Please make sure the USB Debugging prompt has appeared on your phone,
 and click ALLOW. If it does not appear, 
 try unplugging and replugging the cable. 
 If it still does not appear, this unlock is NOT compatible.

Warning: This FRP unlock method may not always work. It will perform best on most devices mid-2022. 


This feature is intended only for owners of devices they personally own or are legally authorized to access. 
Unauthorized use may violate local laws. The developer assumes no responsibility for misuse.

Steps to FRP Unlock (PLEASE READ CAREFULLY, THEN CLOSE THE MESSAGE BOX.):

1. Factory reset the device using the recovery menu. 
If this has already been done, proceed to step 2.

2. Boot up the phone normally. You should see the setup screen. 
Locate a button called something like 'Emergency Call', and click it.
 This usually opens the dialer. If it calls immediately, 
this method will NOT work on your device.

3. After pressing the Emergency Call button, the dialer should be visible. 
Please continue by typing in the following (without quotes): '*#0*#', and press CALL.
 A service/test menu should be opened. If not, you can also try '*#*#88#*#*'. 
If neither of these work, this method will NOT work on your device.

4. Once the service/test menu is open, do not touch anything on the screen. 
Plug one end of a USB cable into your computer, and the other end into the device.

5. When the cable is plugged in, you may now close the message box to continue.

Warning: This FRP unlock method may not always work. It will perform best on most devices. 


This feature is intended only for owners of devices they personally own or are legally authorized to access. 
Unauthorized use may violate local laws. The developer assumes no responsibility for misuse.

Steps to FRP Unlock (method A) (PLEASE READ CAREFULLY, THEN CLOSE THE MESSAGE BOX.):

1. Factory reset the device using the recovery menu. 
If this has already been done, proceed to step 2.

2. Boot up the phone normally. You should see the setup screen. 
Locate a button called something like 'Emergency Call', and click it.
 This usually opens the dialer. If it calls immediately, 
this method will NOT work on your device.

3. After pressing the Emergency Call button, the dialer should be visible. 
Please continue by typing in the following (without quotes): '*#0*#', and press CALL.
 A service/test menu should be opened. If not, you can also try '*#*#88#*#*'. 
If neither of these work, this method will NOT work on your device.

4. Once the service/test menu is open, do not touch anything on the screen. 
Plug one end of a USB cable into your computer, and the other end into the device.

5. When the cable is plugged in, you may now close the message box to continue.

🔓 LG Screen Unlock

The LG Screen Unlock will simply unlock the phone's 
screen, without erasing data whatsoever.

It is only supported on these LG phones. 
Please UNPLUG all devices and CLOSE this window if you do not have one of the below devices:

LG G4 H815
LG G4 H811
LG G4 VS986
LG V10 H901
LG V10 H960
LG G3 D855
LG G3 D851
LG Stylo 2 LS775
LG Tribute HD LS676
LG Phoenix 2 K371
LG Aristo M210
LG Leon H345

If one of these devices is yours, you may click OK and follow the instructions.

🔓 LG Screen Unlock

Please plug your LG phone into your computer, 
then press OK. 

(Note: For this step, you will need GCC 
 installed on your machine. If it's not installed, 
please install it now, then click OK once your phone is plugged in.)
There was an error in unlocking the screen. Please open a GitHub issue with your phone model, and the contents of tmp_output.txt which should be in the same directory as main.py.
Screen should be unlocked. If it's not, please open a GitHub issue with your phone model, and exactly what you did.

Error: Please check your connnection to your device: 
1. Make sure the device is plugged in.
2. Make sure the device is in MTP mode (allow access to phone data)
3. Try enabling DEVELOPER SETTINGS on your device and try again.
\nThe phone did not seem to crash. (If this is a Samsung phone, you must click the reboot option in the SAMSUNG tab on the left.)

Please click OK, then in the browser, press 'Check Blacklist Status.' 
You will then see whether your phone is blacklisted or not.

MAKE SURE NOT TO CLICK ON ADS. SCROLL PAST THEM.
IMEI checked in your Default Web Browser. OK
FRP Unlock \n(Security Patch 𝟤𝟢𝟤𝟦)\n Works on most devices! 🔓

Attempts to unlock a phone 
which has been FRP locked. 

 Usually works on most devices,
including some devices with 
Security Patch Level 𝟤𝟢𝟤𝟦.

Attempts to unlock a phone 
which has been FRP locked. 

 Usually only works on older devices,
specifically from Security
 Patch Level August 𝟤𝟢𝟤𝟤 through
 the December 𝟤𝟢𝟤𝟤 patch.

Attempts to unlock a phone 
which has been FRP locked. 

 Usually only works on older devices,
specifically before Security
 Patch Level August 𝟤𝟢𝟤𝟤
Gets firmware version info from most SAMSUNG phones. \n\n(Works on S24 Series)
Crashes the phone using AT commands as an\nalternate reboot method.

Opens a hidden WIFITEST app, even 
if the setup wizard hasn't completed. 

(Works on S24 Series)
Checks whether the connected device is\n blacklisted, reported as lost, or reported\n as stolen.
Removes basic, user bloatware from the phone. \nThis may uninstall apps that you are using; I am not responsible for data loss.

Unlock the screen of an LG phone, without losing data.

Only click if you are using one of the following phones:

LG G4 H815
LG G4 H811
LG G4 VS986
LG V10 H901
LG V10 H960
LG G3 D855
LG G3 D851
LG Stylo 2 LS775
LG Tribute HD LS676
LG Phoenix 2 K371
LG Aristo M210
LG Leon H345
Starts the MTKCLIENT GUI. This may take a few minutes\n if you're doing it for the first time.

New in v1.3.2: Bug fixes for FRP unlock and version info, improved language compatibility via a strings.xml. 

Full Changelog on https://github.com/nlckysolutions/nPhoneKIT/releases/tag/v1.3.2
Please close this window and rerun using SUDO (or Run as Administrator on Windows). Most features/tools will not work otherwise.
